workflow.name: Sync KPI metrics from ClickUp and Google Sheets to Slack and Gmail
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate daily KPI tracking and reporting by integrating ClickUp tasks and Google Sheets lead data into a unified dashboard. This workflow computes performance metrics, analyzes sentiment, and delivers visualized reports to Slack and Gmail for instant team insights. üìäüí¨üìß

## What This Template Does
- Triggers automatically every day using a cron scheduler. ‚è∞
- Fetches project task data from ClickUp, including status, priority, and assignee metrics.
- Retrieves lead generation data and responses from Google Sheets.
- Merges both data sources to create a unified performance dataset.
- Computes detailed KPI metrics (task completion, overdue %, sentiment analysis, response trends).
- Formats data for reporting and visualization.
- Posts a concise KPI summary snapshot to a designated Slack channel.
- Sends a professionally formatted HTML report via Gmail.
- Notifies your Slack channel instantly in case of any workflow errors.

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Eliminates manual KPI tracking and reporting.
 ‚úÖ Combines ClickUp and Google Sheets data into one view.
 ‚úÖ Provides real-time insights for decision-making.
 ‚úÖ Automates daily updates for consistent visibility.
 ‚úÖ Delivers both quick Slack summaries and detailed email reports.
 ‚úÖ Built-in error alerting ensures uninterrupted automation.

## Features
- Scheduled daily cron trigger for automated execution.
- OAuth2-secured integrations with ClickUp, Google Sheets, Slack, and Gmail.
- Parallel data fetching for faster performance.
- Smart KPI calculations with sentiment and trend analysis.
- Custom HTML email template with visual charts and highlights.
- Slack snapshot notifications for instant updates.
- Error-handling mechanism with Slack alerts.

## Requirements
- ClickUp account with OAuth2 credentials.
- Google Sheets access with OAuth2 credentials.
- Slack API credentials with chat:write permission.
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials for report delivery.

## Target Audience
- Project managers tracking performance KPIs.
- Operations teams needing daily performance visibility.
- Marketing and sales teams monitoring task and lead metrics.
- Automation and analytics engineers building executive dashboards.

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect your ClickUp, Google Sheets, Slack, and Gmail accounts. üîë
- Replace placeholder IDs (Sheet ID, Channel ID, Email) with your actual values.
- Adjust the cron trigger time as per your timezone.
- Test with sample data to confirm correct KPI calculations.
- Enable workflow to start daily automated execution. üöÄ

workflow.name: Sync KPI Metrics from ClickUp and Google Sheets to Slack and Gmail

parameters.content:
## üìä Sync KPI Metrics from ClickUp and Google Sheets to Slack and Gmail

### Workflow Overview
This workflow automatically generates and distributes a comprehensive KPI dashboard report combining:
- **ClickUp Tasks**: Fetch task metrics
- **Google Sheets Leads**: Retrieve lead generation data and responses
- **Analytics Engine**: Process and compute KPI trends
- **Multi-Channel Distribution**: Send reports via Slack and Gmail

### Key Features
‚úÖ Automated daily execution via cron schedule
‚úÖ Real-time task and lead analytics
‚úÖ Slack dashboard snapshots
‚úÖ Error handling and alerting

### Setup Requirements
1. ClickUp OAuth2 credentials
2. Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials
3. Slack API credentials
4. Gmail OAuth2 credentials

### Execution Flow
1. Trigger daily at scheduled time
2. Fetch data from ClickUp and Google Sheets in parallel
3. Merge datasets
4. Compute KPI metrics and trends
5. Format and send reports to Slack and Email
6. Handle errors with Slack notifications

## ‚è∞ Daily Trigger

Schedules workflow execution
at a specific time each day.

Configure your preferred time
and timezone in node settings.

## üîó Fetch ClickUp Tasks

Retrieves task data:
- Status & priority
- Assignees
- Time tracking
- Due dates

Uses OAuth2 authentication

## üìë Fetch Lead Data

Retrieves lead information
from Google Sheets:
- Contact details
- Reply content
- Source tracking
- Status updates

## üîÄ Merge Data

Combines ClickUp tasks and
Google Sheets leads into
a single dataset for analysis.

## üßÆ KPI Analytics

**Calculates metrics:**
- Task completion rates
- Overdue tasks
- Lead sentiment analysis
- Source performance
- Trend indicators

Customize the JavaScript
code to add your own KPIs.

## üì§ Format Data

Structures KPI metrics for
Slack and Gmail outputs.

Extracts key values and
prepares template variables.

## üí¨ Slack Summary

Posts quick KPI snapshot
to your Slack channel.

Update channel ID in
node configuration.

## üìß Email Report

Sends detailed HTML report
with comprehensive KPI analysis,
charts, and insights.

Update recipient email address
in node settings.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Error Alerts

Captures workflow failures
and sends alerts to Slack.

Configure alerts channel
for team notifications.

REPLIES BY DATE

`).join('') }}
üìà Trends & Insights

LEAD TREND

üí° Key Insights:
  • You have {{ $json.tasks.overdue }} overdue tasks that need immediate attention
  • {{ $json.leads.sentiment.positiveRate }}% of leads show positive interest
  • Average task completion time: {{ $json.tasks.avgTimeSpentHours }} hours
  • {{ $json.trends.newReplies }} new lead replies to follow up on

For questions or support, please contact your system administrator

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.
